sections.name: Opening Dialogue: First Meeting
sections.purpose: This dialogue shows a typical first meeting between Japanese people. You'll hear natural pronunciation and polite conversation patterns used in formal introductions.
sections.instructions: 1. Listen to the entire dialogue twice without looking at the book. 2. Open your textbook to page 8 and follow along. 3. Practice reading along with the audio. 4. Try to identify the key vocabulary words you've learned.

sections.name: Vocabulary Practice
sections.purpose: Practice the pronunciation of key vocabulary for introductions and occupations. Focus on correct accent patterns and clear pronunciation.
sections.instructions: Listen to each word carefully and repeat it 3 times. Pay special attention to long vowels and the pronunciation of 'r' sounds. Don't worry about speed - focus on accuracy.

sections.name: Grammar Point: です (desu)
sections.purpose: Understanding how です works as the polite copula 'to be' and its role in formal Japanese sentences. This is fundamental to polite conversation.
sections.instructions: Read the explanation carefully. The です pattern is used constantly in polite Japanese. Practice saying the example sentences with proper intonation.

sections.name: Cultural Note: Business Cards
sections.purpose: Learn about the importance of business cards (名刺 - meishi) in Japanese business culture and how they relate to the language of introductions.
sections.instructions: Consider how the formality of language in the dialogue connects to Japanese business customs. This cultural context helps explain why certain phrases are used.

sections.name: Pronunciation Focus: Long Vowels
sections.purpose: Master the pronunciation of long vowels in Japanese, which can change the meaning of words completely. This is essential for clear communication.
sections.instructions: Listen to each pair of words (short vs. long vowel). The difference is crucial! Practice until you can clearly distinguish and produce both sounds.

sections.name: Review: Putting It Together
sections.purpose: Combine everything you've learned in this lesson: vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation. Practice introducing yourself naturally.
sections.instructions: Use the vocabulary and grammar patterns to introduce yourself. Record yourself and compare to the model dialogue. Focus on natural rhythm and polite language.
